mention.text: `` WASHINGTON -LRB- Reuters -RRB- - President Barack Obama faces the prospect this week of having to offer his congratulations to a new Indian leader who was barred from the United States less than 10 years ago over massacres of Muslims in 2002 .
President Barack Obama faces the prospect
the United States less than 10 years ago over massacres of Muslims
Hindu nationalist Narendra Modi set to become prime minister , with his opposition party and its allies forecast to sweep to a parliamentary majority
an autocratic Hindu supremacist responsible for an outbreak of religious riots in his home state of Gujarat in 2002 in which more than 1,000 people , mostly Muslims , died

a blow for campaigners who have long maintained he is an autocratic Hindu supremacist responsible for an outbreak of religious riots in his home state of Gujarat in 2002 in which more than 1,000 people , mostly Muslims , died
Wasem , a researcher for the Congressional Research Service
a researcher for the Congressional Research Service
a South Asia expert at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
